Cell.Data: The DEV TEAM / MISC NOTES column contains info on what text between { } signs means (if applicable). It usually stands for either a numeric value, or a numeric value with an icon. Text between [ ] signs stands for a certain type of icon.

“What we know:[br/]1. Quartzite require vast geothermal energy to exist.[br/]2. If they are alive and not just constructs, they are not organic.[br/] 3. They appear to originate deep within the planet’s crust.[br/]4. They have been found on nearly all colonized worlds.[br/][br/]My best guess? Either they are the natural embodiment of a natural law exhibited in some evolutionary mechanism we have not yet discovered, or they are a side-effect of Star Union colonization, perhaps caused by terraforming?[br/]Suffice to say, the specimen is a dangerous fiery rock monster.”—Prof. Sendak Volm, “RV-9931S: Scientific Mysteries”

“Prospecting in the Arctic is lonesome business. On land, away from the ice floes, it is tranquil. I don’t expect my cousin, the illustrious Baron, to like it here, but the solitude suits me. I used to miss the rhythmic clank of a Dvartian grinding wheel, but now the quiet is my friend. It warns me when the Liquid Crystal spiders are moving. I hear before they swarm. Arcs of blue electricity crackles as they skitter too close. Now that I consider it, please don’t come visit. I prefer quiet.” —Prospector Dvarton Nan, “RV-2254D: Dvar Cases”

“Not all volcanologists are fools, but Dr. Jenkmen perpetuated the prejudice. He didn’t listen to our mutant guide. The guide refused to take him into the caldera. The guide claimed the rocks moved there. Jenkmen scoffed at the mutant’s fears. ‘I bet his tribe hid treasures there. This is a volcano! Of course, rocks move.’ He rationalized. Poor Professor. He should’ve listened to his guide. As soon as he climbed into the crater, a large rocky hand steaming with glowing coals reached out. He was both crushed and incinerated by a Quarzite Basher.”—Associate Professor Nemar Gupta, “RV-60948S: Geothermal Surveys”

“Brother Rigel climbed the mountain again. He brought back glowing crystals. He says God touched them, and that we should rejoice. He quoted scripture, that with faith enough even the rocks will obey us. We came to this world seeking a sanctuary for believers. I don’t wish to sow doubt, but last night the rocks came to life. A hulking crystal monster bashed through the colony wall. It broke into Brother Rigel’s home and took back the crystals touched by God. Brother Rigel’s dead. I think I liked things better when rocks didn’t move.”—Tomas Marsh, “RV-324R: Promised Land”

“Our Colony on Stellara IV was paradise until the 13th day of the fourth month, when the earth thrust upward. The air rippled with heat. A mouth of fire and rock splayed open and vomited brimstone. Its flaming jaws clamped onto our supply silo. Boulders crunched boulders like great teeth grinding, destroying everything. This titanic glowing lava worm plunged back into the ground. All is quiet now. E-Cells are nearly depleted. We tread lightly on the earth out of fear the Worm will return and finish us off.”—Ram Singer, “RV-9984X: Lost World”

“There is no credible scientific evidence connecting the terraforming technologies pioneered by my client and its subsidiaries to this phenomenon. Terratech Corporation cannot be held liable for the Crystal Worm that burrowed into Cirius-II colony, striking all electronics with its powerful electromagnetic lightning bursts and lobbing quartzite crystals at the plaintiff’s loved ones. My client asks the court to dismiss this case as an Act of God and forgo the need to misappropriate blame upon my client so that the plaintiff can justly mourn their tragic loss.” —Attorney of Law, Almer Mastriss, “RV-0285L: The Relatives of Cirius-II versus Terratech Corporation”
An unstable crystal made of crystalized Arc.
